sections.heading: Empowering Women in Business Through Authentic Connections

sections.title: Business networking with a difference
sections.blurb: If you are a businesswoman owner or are a major shareholder of your company, and you would like to support other like-minded people with support given to yourself, then this is for you!

sections.title: Together through the highs & lows of business

children.text:
Each meeting there is a chance to celebrate each other’s successes and each meeting we have helpful tips for improving each other’s businesses.
Where a lot of networking groups meet to purely pass work with each other, we felt there was a need to have a comfortable place to share each other’s successes and stresses.
Owning a business it is great, and it is important to get out of the office to share experiences and knowledge, what is often called working “on the business, not in the business”.
There seems to be so many different aspects to running a fun and productive business, and rather than just simply network, we felt it was a great time to actually make a difference by support!

sections.title: Where business women get real answers
sections.ctaText: What are you waiting for? Join our group today!

children.text:
In 2004, Business Chicks was formed. The need was to fill a gap in the usual networking meetings for a more support based meeting.
A chance to ask questions about different situations that may stress business owners, like staffing issues, great accountant questions, where to go for admin needs, how to organise a business.

sections.title: Membership
sections.blurb: Business Chicks is a positive environment where members support each other’s businesses. If you are wanting to come for a visit, you are more than welcome.

children.text:
Simply fill in your details through the form on our contact page.
To be a member of Business Chicks: we invite you to come to 2 meetings to see if it is for you and your business.
If there is another company that does something the same as you, this is OK, as Business Chicks is more about the supportive environment to grow as a manager/owner advice on staffing, accounting, promotion etc rather than a hard-out networking group.
You are to be an owner or major share holder of your company.
You are required to come to all meetings where possible, and if not able to then an apology is requested to be given 24 hours before the meeting, to the secretary.
Annual subscription is required of $120.00 per year – member profile and photo is to be given with membership form.

sections.title: When & Where?
sections.blurb: Business Chicks meet on the first Wednesday of each month, as our venues do/can change each month.

children.text:
We meet for 1.5 hours from 12 noon to 1.30pm. You can start arriving from 11.50am.
We meet for a delicious lunch at:

Edgeware Mall, 76 Edgeware Road, St Albans, Christchurch
If you can’t come to a meeting we ask you to send your apologies to the secretary of Business Chicks, so the venue knows how many to expect.

sections.title: We’d love to connect with you
sections.blurb: We are a group of Women in Business who meet monthly to exchange ideas, discuss business issues and build friendships.

data.quote: Business Chicks is a group specifically catering for women business owners. It’s less formal than some other groups, and more focused on education, exchange of ideas, information, and support of each other. The monthly meeting format is ideal for busy women, but often enough to keep up the contact, which suits me really well. Great environment to learn, ask others for advice and enjoy the company of like-minded people. I can highly recommend!
data.name: Joy

data.quote: I have been a member of Business Chicks since 2004 and I love it. Business Chicks is a great place to share successes and also ask for help. Or just have a Business Girls lunch if you work on your own. It is a great place to learn from other successful business women, in a comfortable atmosphere. It is a place to have that moment when you aren’t feeling the strongest, which happens over time in my business I have run since 1997. It can be a lonely business being a business owner not knowing who to ask who for help, and it can be just as hard to celebrate successes without people thinking I am filthy rich. And also a great place to say just how proud I am of what I have achieved. I feel empowered being there for other women business owners, and I know this helps me be a better person all round.
data.name: Phillippa Jacobs-Lory

data.title: BNI – Business Networking International
data.description: International networking group. Givers Gain motto. If you help other businesses they will help you!

data.title: Canterbury Development Corporation
data.description: Courses and mentoring programmes for business in Canterbury.

data.title: Flying solo
data.description: Australian resource for running your own business. A great weekly email newsletter with tips is available.
